Question: You are the project manager and one of your project activities is high-risk with a very high probability that your deadline is impacted. Terms like uniform, normal, triangular, beta and log  are part of tools & techniques of Quantitative Risk Analysis?
Insurance is an example of ___________?
Information-gathering techniques used in the identify Risk process include all of the following except:
Note: [Qno: PML_147] >> Checklist is output of Plan Quality process.

Question: You vendor reported you that some activities will lead to cost overrun. But you informed him that desired product features are more important to us than any cost overrun. what type of risk response is the customer using?
The risk management plan generally includes all the following except:
Note: [Qno: PML_167] >> Responses are planned in Risk Response Plan process

Answers: Identify resources for risk management activities
Definition of risk probability and impact

Question: You are working  with new vendor and it has probability of 40 percent delay on your project and this will result in a $40,000 cost overrun. The expected value for this risk is:

Note: [Qno: PML_235] >> T&T of Perform qualitative Risk Analysis are Risk Probability and impact assessment, Probability and impact matrix, Risk data quality assessment, Risk Categorization, Risk urgency assessment, Expert Judgment

Question: A warranty is an example of risk __________.

You are managing a state-of-the-art technology and highly complex project and it tend to have more uncertainty. While performing qualitative risk analysis which input document would take care of this fact?
Which are the objectives of Project Risk Management?

Answers: To decrease the probability and impact of negative events in the project. To increase the probability and impact of positive events.
To document the causes for the risk when occurring, and to document the risk response.
To identify the project risks and risk responses.

Question: A PMI-RMP (Risk management professional) told you that high level approach to address an individual risk or overall project risk, broken down into a set of risk actions is called _____?

Answers: Project risk can happen at any moment, we should plan for them
You should do what your project manager is saying.
Project risk happens throughout the project execution. We cannot take chance.
Project risk is uncertain, no one can predict when the event will happen but we should plan about them

Question: You customer requested you to join a meeting next week. Note: [Qno: PML_313] >> Contingency reserve is used to manage known unknown risk. Human Resource attribution is known unknown.

Question: Management reserves are a which of the following?

Answers: For doing big parties, it is applicable only for big projects.
Separate money set aside to cover known unknowns.
Separate budget to cover cost of schedule overrun
Separate budget account set aside to cover unknowns.

Note: [Qno: PML_344] >> Assumption leads to injection of risk in project. Others will help in eliminating risk.

Note: [Qno: PML_412] >> Probability is still 1 %. It cannot be 100 % because it is not certain event.

Question: Which tool you will use to create Risk Management Plan?
To perform active risk acceptance what should be done?

Answers: Develop a plan to minimize impact so that if an identified risk occurs impact can be reduced.
Develop a plan to minimize the probability of occurrence for identified risks.
Create contingency reserves in resources, money and time.
Make additional resources available to speed up the project.

Question: During Risk identification sessions, you and your team identified more than 100 risks for your project. You couldn’t sleep that night because the amount of time and energy required to make risk response plan for these risks is not available with you. You PMP friend suggested you that you should -------

Answers: Use Qualitative risk analysis in order to prioritize risks for further action, such as Quantitative risk analysis.
Assess the probability of each risk qualitatively and further analyze only those risks with high probability.
Assess the potential impact of each risk qualitatively and further analyze only those risks with high impact.
Identify Risk triggers wherever possible. Develop risk response plan only for those risks for which no trigger could be found.

Answers: You failed to develop Risk Breakdown Structure
You have not identified risk triggers

You are not monitoring & controlling risks

Note: [Qno: PML_728] >> A risk trigger is an indication that the risk is about to occur or has occurred.

Answers: Risk identification happens in all the phases of the project.
Risk register has list of only expired risks
You should take action only when risk has occurred

Question: Which of the following is an output of the Identify Risks process.
Note: [Qno: PML_752] >> Risk Register is the only output of the Risk identification process.

Question: With triangular distribution, the low, likely and high values are 20, 30 and 40, respectively. The mean is _____.
Which is a valid response to positive risks?
Note: [Qno: PML_932] >> Positive risks may be responded by - "Exploit", "Enhance", "Share", "Accept".

Question: Which is a valid response to negative risks?
Note: [Qno: PML_933] >> Risk mitigation is a response to negative risks.

Question: Which of the following is NOT true regarding Risk Management Plan?
Note: [Qno: PML_991] >> Risk register is updated when trigger for risk occurs.

Answers: Risk Management Plan is an output of Plan Risk Management process
Risk Management Plan will be updated when the trigger for a major risk occurs
Risk Management Plan includes the categories of risk, their definition and Definition of risk probability and impact
Plan Risk Management is an input to all the remaining Risk Planning processes

Question: Tornado diagrams are part of
In Probability and Impact Metrics which of the following statement is true?

Answers: For opportunities, the low risk zone offers lowest risk and best benefits
For threat, the high risk zone offers greatest benefits
For opportunities, the high risk zone offers greatest benefits
For threat the low risk zone should be addressed first

Question: Which of the following statement is true about Beta & Triangular Distribution

Answers: Beta Distribution and Triangular distribution are commonly used in stakeholder analysis
Beta Distribution and Triangular distribution are probability distributions used in Quality control to analyze the defect data
Beta Distribution and Triangular distribution are probability distributions used in Risk Analysis
Beta Distribution and Triangular distribution are used in Cost Variance Analysis

Question: Where do you maintain low probability low impact risk, so that you can monitor them from time to time but do not waste much time on those.
Note: [Qno: PML_1167] >> A watchlist is the place to keep risks that don’t have a high enough probability or impact to make. But they still need to be monitored. By recording the risk in a watchlist, you will have a reminder to check to be sure that circumstances haven’t changed as your project goes on. That should give you enough time to come up with a risk response strategy if circumstances change as time goes on.

Answers: In the Probability and Impact Matrix
In the Monte Carlo analysis report

Question: You are working onsite with your customer and you have identified an opportunity to potentially increase the project’s value. Which of the following is an example of enhancing that opportunity?
Note:
[Qno: PML_1193] >> There are four things you can do with any opportunity. 1- You can exploit the opportunity by making sure you do everything to take the advantage of it.
2- You can share the opportunity by working with another company in a way that gives you a win-win situation.
3- You can enhance the opportunity by figuring out a way to increase its value.
4- Accept the opportunity as it is and move, if you cannot take advantage of the opportunity

Answers: By forming a partnership with another company, the project’s value will increase for both companies
By taking additional actions, you increase the potential reward without reducing its probability
By taking out insurance, you can reduce potential costs to the project
By documenting the opportunity in the register, you can keep track of it and ensure it gets exploited

Question: A project manager uses a facilitator to gather opinions from experts anonymously. What risk identification tool or technique is being performed?
Note: [Qno: PML_1203] >>  The Delphi technique is used  to get opinions and ideas from experts. This technique  uses a facilitator and he questionnaires to ask experts about important project risks. Answer is taken from experts and circulated again among experts anonymously so that experts can give unbiased genuine feedback.

Question: Which of the following is NOT a tool or technique of Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis?
Note:
[Qno: PML_1216] >> Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis is all about prioritizing each risk based on probability and impact. Perform Quantitative Risk Analysis is about quantitative decision making, EMV analysis is part of it.
Remember, quantitative means numbers and qualitative means judgments!

Question: You are project manager of a software project and you have outsourced one component to the subcontractor. Based on the input received in last meeting you found that there is only 30% probability that subcontractor will be able to deliver you the component on time. And if he fail to do so it will cost you $10,000 extra to your engineers to rewrite the component. And $15,000 business will be lost due to delay in project. While discussing this problem with your technical leader he comes up with an idea that similar kind of ready made component is available at some site and using this will save project around $6,000. But there is 60% probability that our team can take the advantage of that. What is the EMV of this risk?
Note:
[Qno: PML_1219] >> To calculate the expected monetary value (EMV) of a set of threat and opportunities, multiply each probability by its total cost and add them together.

Cost of Threat = $10,000+$15,000 = $ 25,000
Probability of occurring risk 70% (100-30= 70%)
EMV of this threat = 70% x 25,000 = - $17,500
Cost of Opportunity = $6,000
Probability of occurring risk is 60%
EMV of this opportunity= 60% x 6,000 = 3,600
Total EMV of risk = -$17,500 + $3,600 = - $13,900
Cost of a threat is negative, and the cost of an opportunity is positive.

Question: You are working on a pharmaceutical project and you identified that due to inefficient distillation process 20% of the chemical would be wasted therefore you ordered extra 22% chemical for the process so that project won’t face the delay because of reordering. This is what type of risk response strategy?
Note: [Qno: PML_1224] >> You are taking action to mitigate the impact of risk.  Risk mitigation means taking some sort of action that will minimize the damage, if risk occurs. Or reduce the probability of happening the risk

Question: Based on your past experience you know that your subcontractor may not deliver the work on time therefore you decided to assign 2 of your team members to search alternative solution as fall back plan. Which of the following BEST describes this scenario?
Note: [Qno: PML_1235] >> Risk mitigation means taking some sort of action that will minimize the damage if risk occurs. Or reduce the probability of happening the risk

Question: While reviewing your risk register you found a risk that remains even after you have implemented all of your response strategies. What kind of risk is this and what should you do about it?
Note: [Qno: PML_1244] >> Residual risks are those that that remain in project even after you have planned and implemented all of your risk response strategies. They don’t need any further analysis because you have already planned the most complete response strategy.

Answers: It’s a residual risk; you cannot do anything of those.
It’s a residual risk; you need to plan a response strategy for it
It’s a secondary risk; you don’t need to worry about it
It is a secondary risk; you should plan for avoidance of this.

Question: Hari is a project manager for a web development project. The project has a 70% chance of making the company $200,000 over the six months. It has a 30% chance of costing the company $100,000. What’s the project’s EMV?
Note:
[Qno: PML_1252] >> While calculating EMV, add those risk which saves money for you (opportunities) treat them as positive and multiply by the probability of happening and add those risk which cost you money treat them as negative and multiply by probability of happening. Add both together

70% x 200,000 = 140,000
30% x 100,000 = 30,000
EMV = 140,000 - 30,000 = 110,000

Question: You project is progressing well with all planning activities. You have sat down with the customer for a JAD session to review some alternatives for proceeding with the project. The customer wants to model some of the potential alternatives forward to see which one of these alternatives offers the best solution. This type of analysis is called
Note: [Qno: PML_1445] >> The technique that uses modeling is the Monte Carlo simulation. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 438

Question: An unprecedented problem has surfaced in your project and the response plan for this problem is NOT mentioned in your risk register. How would you address this kind of issues
Note: [Qno: PML_1466] >> A workaround is defined as a response to a negative risk that was not part of original risk planning. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 453. It is usually a solution developed "on-the-fly" until a permanent solution can be derived

Answers: Cannot do anything of these kind of unplanned risks

Question: What is the expected monetary value (EMV)?
Note: [Qno: PML_1480] >>  The expected monetary value (EMV) is statistical technique to calculate the future outcome of a risk. It outlines the potential cost of a negative risk or the potential benefit of a positive risk. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 434

Answers: What the project ROI will be
The potential cost/benefit of a risk, positive or negative
The amount of the risk contingency budget
The cost baseline minus the risk contingency

Question: On your project you buy insurance for all the equipments what type of risk response plan this is?
Management reserves are used to handle which type of risk?
Note: [Qno: PML_1856] >> Unpredictable, unthought, unplanned risk, disaster should be managed using management reserve. Special approval is required from management to utilize this fund

Question: You are trying to reduce the impact of a risk event by reducing the possibility of its occurrence. This is called
Which is not a tool used for Risk Response Planning
Note: [Qno: PML_1984] >> Risk Audit is Monitoring & Controlling Tool

Question: You are working on an big IT project and have identified few complex components for which you know that there are better companies in market to deliver it in much efficient way at lesser cost. So you decide to outsource these complex components to 10 sub-contracting IT companies at  Fixed Price contract. In this context, all the following statements relating to transferring of risk to a contractor are true EXCEPT:
Note:
[Qno: PML_2058] >> Option1: Not necessarily true. Otherwise why people would like to take insurance if more than the value at risk has to be paid out.
Option2/Option3: As per PMBoK Fixed price contracts are always in favor of buyer and Cost plus contracts are in favor of seller
Optione4: Contracts are designed with intention of transferring the risk to some party. Thus transfers the liability also.

Answers: Risk transference always involves payment of a premium more than the risk amount.
Fixed price contract always transfers the risk to the seller.
Cost-plus contracts are not in favor of buyer
Contracts are used for the transference of liability for specified risks to another party.
